content.description: A totally cool crack in a right facing dihedral.
content.location: As you face the area from the railroad it is a dihedral crack slightly to the rigt.

content.description:
Alternating right and left facing crack. 

  "5.9ish" in Eric Ulner's "Vertical Heartland".
content.location: Right of the Sweeper/Creeper ramp system

climbs.name: Top Of The Morning To You

content.description: Climb the Lighter Colored "White" face to the right of a gully that zig zags.Â
content.location: Left and around the corner from Bottom Feeder

content.description: It is the sweeping crack (get it?) with the same start as Creeper.  Start as Creeper, but cut right and ascend the sweeping slabby dihedral.
content.location: just to the right of Creeper.

content.description: A really wild and, as the name implies, hard slab.  A wacky thumb mantel crux on often moss covered rock often proves interesting.
content.location: If you enter the Railroad area from the railroad it is directly across from the railroad about a hundred feet away.  the furthest right route on the slabby wall.

content.description: A WAAAYYY hard overhung and seemingly featureless face near the arete on the lefthand side of the face.
content.location: If you look from the railroad tracks it is the area you are looking directly at through the trees.

content.description: The crux is the last move before the anchors.  Most of the hand and foot placements are on large iron flakes.
content.location: The routes is near the end of the railroad area.  It is about 170 feet from the 2nd class walk up gully.  It is between Mother's day special and Cheap fame.

content.description: Climb the face between the tree on the left side, and the right arete.
content.location: The face around the arete, to the left from IN/Access Granted.

climbs.name: Mother's Day Special
climbs.fa: Jeff Allison, Jim Schneider, Mother's Day 1994

content.description: Fun slab/small pocket traverse. Avoid using jugs on 'Procrastination'.
content.location: Starts by large slanted crack 20 feet right of 'Procrastination'. Move up and traverse upwards left to anchors.

climbs.name: Love Isn't Always On Time
climbs.fa: Nick Tripp 2018, or probably some guy in the 80s

content.description:
Climb surprisingly fun offwidth/squeeze in the corner.  Jam in while you jam out to whatever song is stuck in your head at the time. A good warm-up for Feeding the Rat around the corner. 

  This was probably FA'ed sometime in the 80s, but I haven't found a record of it.  If you did, let me know and I'll update it.
content.protection:
A single rack of cams. I brought big gear (read: a #5, #6, and Valley Giant 12" cam) and used them, but there seemed to be sufficient smaller pro deep back in the chimney. 

  (Small) tree anchor at the top.
content.location: It's the crack left around the corner from Feeding the Rat.

content.description: Start on the large block and climb up the left leaning crack, then proceed to climb the face and arete.
content.location: on the front wall, facing the tracks. Shares the same start as Access Granted.

content.protection: Two #6 would be nice, Big bro's, anchor on tree
content.location: Obvious wide crack left of Slab Stick Comedy, right of Bottom Feeder

content.description: Climb up and eventually through a small gulley
A super technical climb that goes up the wall perpindicual to Slab Stick Comedy.  Way hard and way cool.
content.location: It is a thinly pocketed line on the middle of the wall perpindicular to Slab Stick comedy.  To date the only line on the wall.

content.description: Fight you way to the to the slab at the start to find yourself on a technical slab, making use of pockets and the arete.
content.location: In the center of the back wall. Located between "Slab Stick Comedy" on the right, and "Top to the Mourning to You" on the left.

content.description: Begin on the large block (same start as "IN"), but break off right.
content.location: On the front wall facing the railroad tracks. Shares the same start as "IN".

content.description: This is the cliff line directly behind Railroad Rock. This area includes Slab Stick Comedy and Bottom Feeder. Note, this is known and Railroad Rock Back Wall in the newest guidebook.
